thread.title: Colorado City Considers Eliminating Fluoride From Water
thread.title_full: Colorado City Considers Eliminating Fluoride From Water

author: CBS Denver
title: Colorado City Considers Eliminating Fluoride From Water

organizations.name: colorado city considers eliminating fluoride from water colorado city

text:
Colorado City Considers Eliminating Fluoride From Water February 8, 2017 4:58 PM 
DENVER (CBS4) – Voters in southwestern Colorado will soon decide whether to continue adding fluoride to their water. 
The Durango City Council voted to place the question on the ballot after a year-long debate. Water faucet (credit: CBS) 
Councilors are encouraging residents to do their research before the vote. They say Durango’s water only has .7 milligrams of fluoride per liter. That’s less than one drop in 55 gallons. 
Additional Resources 
Review the results of tests done on the water before and after treatment by visiting the City of Durango’s website .
